text: Better Alt-Text.

name: hannah
text: i wonder if onstad keeps a notebook to write down those crazy assed beststitute names because there are loads of the damn things and i bet they don't just come naturally to a feller at a keyboard.

name: huber
text: haha yeah - I love when pat talks in one of them about mixing zinc capsules in with his mixed nuts.

name: fuckalgebra
text: It was actually Vitamin E gel caps in the trail mix he was giving his friends for Christmas.

name: whuppins
text: I think that sometimes he'd like to just do a 24-panel comic with nothing but Pat reciting the names of fictional health foods.

name: spinynorman
text:
I got a feeling Pat's food has chemistry people hair, along with the aforementioned armpit hair, Jetta, and fondness for Ani Difranco.

To be Frank, I'm pretty sure I see Pat's food down at Seattle's Best Coffee about once a month. There's a buffer gap of about a foot before and in front of him in the line.

name: sharkofsomerton
text: A comment left by sharkofsomerton was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by tekende, riotdejaneiro, SirFrederick, Vondicus, atticusonline, mystkmanat, TheGreatestCape)

name: hawaiian_robot
text: I'm glad you put 'ba dum tish' there, because I'm pretty sure I wouldn't have gotten it otherwise.

name: tfaironpirate
text: What was sarcasm for you was my own sad reality.

name: greenkoolayd
text: pat is a cat, so hes physically able to toss his own...

name: saint
text: high in health but low on class

name: fermatprime
text: "Mr. Krushchev Don't Push That Button Mushroom" sounds like something you could get at Trader Joe's. Seriously every time I go in there it's like I'm back in tenth-grade English class, except the puns are even worse .

name: anomalous3
text: The truth is that healthy food CAN taste awesome. Pat is just a dick and subconsciously seeks to ruin things that might otherwise be delicacies by trying to get them to taste something else

name: anomalous3
text: *taste like something else*

name: hellofyellin
text:
Healthy food can taste good, I applaud you, but I know people who talk like this.

ps they eat raw food they are raw foodists

name: epicurus
text:
healthy food can taste good, but I think there are people of the mentality "if it doesn't taste like grass clippings it is not healthy".

P.S: Is the term "best-titute" a real term? it sounds so holier-than-thou.

name: ferdinand
text: that's the point, brother.  remember the guy using the term.

name: mastronaut
text:
The same man who used the term Eco-telligent.

Gross

name: cathaoir
text: I agree. I just started on a diet to try and lose my beer gut, and I've been eating all sorts of healthy stuff. Chicken breast, if seasoned well, is both healthy and crazy-delicious. I am, however, still unsure of how I feel about eating raw spinach. Eating stuff that looks like I've just gone and picked leaves off a bush makes me feel foolish.

name: phy
text: There is a special feeling of loathing in my heart for "salads" that look like they just came off the business end of a weed trimmer

name: achilleselbow
text: Is chicken breast still healthy if you pour hella cream of mushroom soup over it? Because that's what I do and it's awesome.

name: cathaoir
text: It might be slightly fattening what with the cream part, but mushrooms are good for you I suppose. Go for it, I'd say.

name: tekende
text: That sounds delicious.

name: tekende
text: Okay, so the other night I baked some chicken legs (I like dark meat). I put the chicken in a pan and sprinkled some paprika on it. Then I heated some cream of mushroom soup and when it finally resembled soup instead of can-shaped gelatin, I poured it over the chicken, then baked it for like an hour. It was great. The soup cooked and formed kind of a second skin for the chicken.

name: pogo
text: Not bad, but you could'a baked the chicken in soup with some rice, and that would produce a different dish -- maybe better with boneless breasts.  Some celery and carrot chunks, too, mmmmm.

name: tekende
text: Yes, that is a good idea too! Actually similar to something my mom used to make.

name: greenkoolayd
text: heh... you have jungle fever.

name: boredom_man
text:
No, that's not remotely healthy.

Try marinating chicken thighs in a mixture of butter, olive oil, soy sauce, garlic, and rosemary.

That's not remotely healthy, either. But it's simple and I like it.

name: pogo
text: No, read the label of that soup, it's loaded with salt, for one thing.

name: boredom_man
text: I'm in luck, there -- I hate lettuce. I'm eating mostly spinach salad and salmon patties  <strike>and massive baked potatoes drenched in asadero and ranch sauce</strike>  but I'm not having much luck trimming down...

name: mangtastic
text: I have a garden and I grow spinach. I pick it from a spinach bush and eat it raw, just like that. It is also really good for you and tasty as hell and I don't pay for it except for like a dollar or so for the seeds and is that really all that foolish?

name: glorify
text: Chubby for the spinach Respect.

name: splendorr
text: But there's the chance that Birds or other Pests may have touched what you ate. Before you ate it.

name: mangtastic
text: There's also a chance that some sweaty guy named Marty had his greasy mits all over your hamburger before it was packaged and shipped to your supermarket.

name: jackparsons
text: Health food used to be nasty so baby boomers are used to nasty. They don't like the new good stuff at Whole Paycheck.

name: tourach3
text:
chubby for 'whole paycheck'
i'll stick with 65 cent cans of tuna thankyouverrrymuch

name: notcool
text: Man, tell me where you find cans of tuna for sixty-five cents, and I'll stock up like I lived in MONTANA.

name: tekende
text: It is pretty close to 65 cents at Walmart.

name: wozzeck
text: A steak is healthy. A steak tastes fantastic.

text: alt text: Pat's food blares Ani Difranco as it pulls away from high school

name: professorhazard
text: I have known the stereotype that this represents, and it thrills me that someone else dislikes it enough to make it the avatar of Pat Reynolds's nasty-ass food.

name: nathanielperson
text: Marzipan != cod. If I only know one thing, I know this.

name: fuckyoufriday
text: No "bestitute" could top the "Souvlaki With a Conscience 'Slaveless Universe' Souvlaki" from Pat's blog.

name: lrosetw8
text: "Awww, do I Kruschev?"

text: DID SOMEBODY SAY KRUSCHEV?

*BANG* *BANG*

THESE ARE NOT MY SHOES!

text: i just want you to know how happy this made me.  all fake techno in the background.

text: I would not eat a bagel with even the weakest connexion to a GloryHole

name: jack
text: I was wondering if anyone else noticed that. Doublegross.

name: kochipoik
text: Pat is giving Ray an orange flavoured colon loofah. (colon loofah = shower time for your anus?) Is Pat trying to tell Ray that he's gay? Why else would you want an orange flavoured ass.

name: professorhazard
text: I believe the basic idear is that it is eaten, tastes orangey, and then scrubs your colon on the way through until it is red and shiny, resulting in a gut-clenching torrent of diarrhea.

name: plummet
text:
holy shit oh my god

SCIENCE

name: godfatherofsouls
text: i have forgotten everything i know about craveless nori

name: tekende
text: Yeah, well, I don't even know what craveless nori is.

name: i_love_kate
text: Why the hell would you need a vegan substitute for nori anyway? It's dried seaweed. It probably has the gluten content of a vacuum, too.

name: tekende
text: Obviously because of the craves

name: rocketbunny
text:
But this nori is probably specially harvested to avoid disrupting all of the microfauna that potentially adheres to regular nori, and is grown in special above-ground tanks to avoid industrial runoff contamination.
And now that I've said all of that, I need to go eat something fried and drink brown liquors.

name: speth
text: Bitter Barry.

name: xiaomimi
text:
Thursday Blogs

Lyle: sfuckin over
Nice Pete: A last-ditch publisher.

name: diggydow
text: 5 for the alt-text

name: drago25
text: Man do I ever hate health food, and this is probably the best send-up of it I've seen yet

name: relaxing
text: Chompsky.

name: charchar
text:
I love health food, I really do. I also love junk food. If you were to offer me the choice between Oreos or roasted vegetables in organic broth, I would probably beat you with my noodly-vegetarian arms and take them both.

I have neither a '91 Jetta nor hairy pits.

This is my life as seen through the filter of Achewood.

name: i_love_kate
text: (Dude this is such a lie you have such hairy pits.)

name: direhaggis
text: You know Pat is revving up to be a fucking dick when he busts out the portmanteaus and glory holes.

name: twincannon
text: Jetta: the car by assholes, for assholes.

name: redzerostar
text: my former roommate named her cat jetta.

name: smilebuddha
text: Jetta: the car my asshole brother drives.

name: deliciousmuffin
text:
I actually kinda felt sorry for Pat there. He looked so excited to actually be helping someone for a change, even if it was in his own weird way.
But then again I'm probably going to easy on him, and the next thing he would've pulled out of that bag was a notebook full of instructions on how to eat each one of those "food" items, along with a rigorous exercise program.

name: deliciousmuffin
text: too easy* Dangit.

name: echidnaboy
text: Pat doesn't give a damn about Ray's health. Pat's a dick . He sees Ray's diabetes crisis simply as an opportunity to shill his tasteless grey mush.

name: scifigrl47
text: No, he brought the best-itutes for Ray to "try."  He didn't bring Ray packages of food to stock his kitchen with, he is going to portion out exactly one half tablespoon of his superior food, then pack it back up and remove it from Ray's slovenly presence.  Because he is Pat.

name: woodenteeth
text: It's a shame that Ani Defranco gets lumped with dipshits. That girl has some fucking serious guitar chops.

name: mattylite
text: I have always thought that about her.  People don't notice.  She could be in like an elite club of musicians who are secretly awesome at guitar but nobody talks about them that way, along with David Byrne, uh, how about J. Mascis, and I suppose there must be plenty more but now I can't think of them.

name: woodenteeth
text: These people are all songwriters first and foremost and virtuosic musicians second, fortunately. Although it's a bad example John Mayer is another one, unfortunately his song writing, although understated is all kinds of "meh".

name: mtrott
text: Ani DiFranco is the female Dave Matthews. An eternity of guitar plucking and poetry that should have remained on a coffee-stained napkin is what she is. Also, plenty of people love J. Mascis, how do you think he got his own branded Fender?

name: mattylite
text: Whoa, I didn't know about that. Sparkly.

name: mattylite
text: P.S.  I don't like Ani Difranco, I just grudgingly admit she is good and even kind of original at guitar.  I hate even worse to half-admit the same of Dave Matthews, but here I am, half-admitting it.  Damnit.

name: woodenteeth
text: Dave Matthews was excellent once. Ani Difranco, as can be expected from a ludicrously prolific recording artist really should be leaving some of the poetry on the coffee stained napkin and some of those notes unplucked. There is bound to be shit amoung the gold.

name: rocketbunny
text: Yes. I dearly love Ani DiFranco (as well as Chris Smither, and other underappreciated guitarists), but I agree that it is extremely impossible to find an artist of any sort whose entire body of work I completely love. The more prolific they are, the more of their work I am bound to dislike. I think it's a mark of distinction if I can find a whole CD I can listen to without wanting to skip any tracks.

name: splendorr
text: Ani DiFranco's main concern is that you respect her guitar abilities but still call her "that girl."

name: woodenteeth
text: I also use the phrase "that boy", "that kid", and occasionally "kiddo". My condescension really knows know gender, age, or skill-set boundaries. I'm sorry if this offends you snookums.

name: fancyrat
text: Clicked four, read the alt text, clicked five.

name: dasilodavi
text: Best-stitutes.  really.  Fuck this guy.

name: maledictis
text: Why is it that Roast Beef dies numerous times and yet Pat has still never died ONCE? There is NO JUSTICE in this world.

name: anzio
text: I love how out of all that terrible crap, Pat actually did get one normal thing in the form of some generic gum with no name.
